user_error_text: After recent updates I see 'Browser slow to open'.
symptoms: Symptoms: Browser slow to open. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Software / Application Performance Issues.
cause: Inefficient application behavior, bugs, or incompatibility causing slow response.
step_1: Update the problematic application to the latest version.
step_2: Clear the app cache or reset app settings if available.
step_3: Reinstall the app if performance issues persist.
step_4: Check for known issues or patches from the app vendor.
step_5: Limit resource-heavy features or use alternative lighter apps.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Browser slow to open - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: I notice: Browser memory leak — system responds poorly.
symptoms: Symptoms: Browser memory leak. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Low RAM / Memory Pressure.
cause: Insufficient physical memory or memory leaks causing paging and slowdowns.
step_1: Check memory usage in Task Manager and close memory-hungry apps.
step_2: Increase virtual memory (paging file) temporarily if needed.
step_3: Restart the system to clear memory leaks and cached data.
step_4: If RAM pressure is frequent, add more RAM modules or close unused apps.
step_5: Use lighter browser settings (fewer tabs/extensions) to reduce memory use.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Browser memory leak - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: I notice: Weak CPU can't handle apps — system responds poorly.
symptoms: Symptoms: Weak CPU can't handle apps. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Hardware Aging / Limitations.
cause: Aging components (HDD, CPU, RAM) no longer meet workload requirements.
step_1: Check component benchmarks vs current software requirements.
step_2: Upgrade bottleneck components (SSD, RAM, CPU) where possible.
step_3: Reduce graphical or compute settings in resource-heavy applications.
step_4: Keep drivers and firmware up to date to improve compatibility.
step_5: If device is old, consider replacing it for better performance.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Weak CPU can't handle apps - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: Game CPU bottleneck — performance is very bad.
symptoms: Symptoms: Game CPU bottleneck. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: High CPU Usage Problems.
cause: High CPU demand by apps/processes, runaway tasks, or insufficient CPU for workload.
step_1: Open Task Manager (Ctrl+Shift+Esc) and sort processes by CPU to find the culprit.
step_2: End the high-CPU process if it's non-essential and relaunch the app.
step_3: Disable unnecessary startup programs (Settings → Apps → Startup).
step_4: Run a virus scan to check for malware causing CPU spikes.
step_5: If CPU is frequently maxed, consider upgrading CPU or optimizing workloads.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Game CPU bottleneck - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

category: Background Processes & Too Many Startup Apps
user_error_text: After recent updates I see 'Telemetry services slowing system'.
symptoms: Symptoms: Telemetry services slowing system. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Background Processes & Too Many Startup Apps.
cause: Too many startup apps or background services using CPU, disk, or network resources.
step_1: Open Startup settings and disable unnecessary startup apps.
step_2: Use Task Manager to identify background services consuming resources and stop them.
step_3: Perform a clean boot to isolate which service/app causes slowdown.
step_4: Uninstall rarely used programs and disable heavy telemetry services.
step_5: Schedule heavy tasks (backups, updates) for off-hours.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Telemetry services slowing system - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: I notice: Insufficient RAM for multitasking — system responds poorly.

cause: Aging components (HDD, CPU, RAM) no longer meet workload requirements.
step_1: Check component benchmarks vs current software requirements.
step_2: Upgrade bottleneck components (SSD, RAM, CPU) where possible.

user_error_text: After recent updates I see 'Read/Write throttling'.
symptoms: Symptoms: Read/Write throttling. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: High Disk Usage / Disk Bottleneck.
cause: Background indexing, failing drive, paging, or heavy I/O operations causing disk bottleneck.
step_1: Open Task Manager and check disk usage; identify processes with heavy I/O.
step_2: Run `chkdsk` and check drive health with SMART tools like CrystalDiskInfo.
step_3: Disable Windows Search or Superfetch temporarily to test impact.
step_4: Free disk space by deleting large unused files and cleaning temp files.
step_5: Consider upgrading to an SSD if using an old HDD.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Read/Write throttling - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: Low disk space warning happens when I run multiple apps.
symptoms: Symptoms: Low disk space warning. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Storage Capacity Issues.
cause: Low free space forcing excessive paging and preventing caching; fragmented drives.
step_1: Free up space on C: by deleting large temporary files and uninstalling unused apps.
step_2: Use Disk Cleanup and Storage Sense to remove temp files and old system files.
step_3: Move large media files to an external drive to free internal storage.
step_4: Consider upgrading to a larger SSD or adding a secondary drive.
step_5: Defragment HDDs (not SSDs) to improve access times.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Low disk space warning - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: After recent updates I see 'CPU overheating causing slowdown'.
symptoms: Symptoms: CPU overheating causing slowdown. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Overheating & Thermal Throttling.
cause: Thermal throttling due to poor cooling or high ambient temperature.
step_1: Monitor temps with HWMonitor or similar; check if CPU/GPU temps exceed safe limits.
step_2: Clean dust from heatsinks and ensure fans spin properly.
step_3: Reapply thermal paste to CPU if it's old.
step_4: Ensure case airflow is good; move the system to a cooler location.
step_5: If laptop, use a cooling pad; consider upgrading cooler for desktops.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: CPU overheating causing slowdown - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

symptoms: Symptoms: Slow app loading. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Software / Application Performance Issues.
cause: Inefficient application behavior, bugs, or incompatibility causing slow response.
step_1: Update the problematic application to the latest version.
step_2: Clear the app cache or reset app settings if available.
step_3: Reinstall the app if performance issues persist.
step_4: Check for known issues or patches from the app vendor.
step_5: Limit resource-heavy features or use alternative lighter apps.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Slow app loading - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: Old HDD slow boot — performance is very bad.
symptoms: Symptoms: Old HDD slow boot. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: High Disk Usage / Disk Bottleneck.
cause: Background indexing, failing drive, paging, or heavy I/O operations causing disk bottleneck.
step_1: Open Task Manager and check disk usage; identify processes with heavy I/O.
step_2: Run `chkdsk` and check drive health with SMART tools like CrystalDiskInfo.
step_3: Disable Windows Search or Superfetch temporarily to test impact.
step_4: Free disk space by deleting large unused files and cleaning temp files.
step_5: Consider upgrading to an SSD if using an old HDD.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Old HDD slow boot - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

error_name: System freezing due to low memory
user_error_text: After recent updates I see 'System freezing due to low memory'.
symptoms: Symptoms: System freezing due to low memory. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Low RAM / Memory Pressure.
cause: Insufficient physical memory or memory leaks causing paging and slowdowns.
step_1: Check memory usage in Task Manager and close memory-hungry apps.
step_2: Increase virtual memory (paging file) temporarily if needed.
step_3: Restart the system to clear memory leaks and cached data.
step_4: If RAM pressure is frequent, add more RAM modules or close unused apps.
step_5: Use lighter browser settings (fewer tabs/extensions) to reduce memory use.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: System freezing due to low memory - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'Slow Windows boot time' and becomes slow.
symptoms: Symptoms: Slow Windows boot time. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Windows System Corruption / OS Problems.
cause: Corrupt system files, problematic updates or registry issues degrading performance.
step_1: Run `sfc /scannow` to repair system files and `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth`.
step_2: Check Event Viewer for performance-related errors and investigate.
step_3: Uninstall recent problematic updates if performance dropped after an update.
step_4: Consider an in-place upgrade repair using Windows installation media.
step_5: Backup data and perform a clean install if corruption is extensive.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Slow Windows boot time - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: I notice: Lag due to background downloads — system responds poorly.
symptoms: Symptoms: Lag due to background downloads. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Network & Internet Slowdowns (System-wide impact).
cause: Slow network affecting cloud apps and downloads, causing perceived system slowness.
step_1: Run a speed test and confirm if network speeds are below expected.
step_2: Pause background updates and large downloads to free bandwidth.
step_3: If Wi‑Fi, move closer to the router or use Ethernet for stable connection.
step_4: Check router and ISP status for external issues.
step_5: Use QoS settings on router to prioritize critical apps.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Lag due to background downloads - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'Antivirus high CPU' and becomes slow.
symptoms: Symptoms: Antivirus high CPU. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: High CPU Usage Problems.
cause: High CPU demand by apps/processes, runaway tasks, or insufficient CPU for workload.
step_1: Open Task Manager (Ctrl+Shift+Esc) and sort processes by CPU to find the culprit.
step_2: End the high-CPU process if it's non-essential and relaunch the app.
step_3: Disable unnecessary startup programs (Settings → Apps → Startup).
step_4: Run a virus scan to check for malware causing CPU spikes.
step_5: If CPU is frequently maxed, consider upgrading CPU or optimizing workloads.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Antivirus high CPU - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

cause: Thermal throttling due to poor cooling or high ambient temperature.

user_error_text: After recent updates I see 'C drive full'.
symptoms: Symptoms: C drive full. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Storage Capacity Issues.
cause: Low free space forcing excessive paging and preventing caching; fragmented drives.
step_1: Free up space on C: by deleting large temporary files and uninstalling unused apps.
step_2: Use Disk Cleanup and Storage Sense to remove temp files and old system files.
step_3: Move large media files to an external drive to free internal storage.
step_4: Consider upgrading to a larger SSD or adding a secondary drive.
step_5: Defragment HDDs (not SSDs) to improve access times.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: C drive full - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

category: Background Processes & Too Many Startup Apps
user_error_text: My PC shows 'Too many startup programs' and becomes slow.
symptoms: Symptoms: Too many startup programs. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Background Processes & Too Many Startup Apps.
cause: Too many startup apps or background services using CPU, disk, or network resources.
step_1: Open Startup settings and disable unnecessary startup apps.
step_2: Use Task Manager to identify background services consuming resources and stop them.
step_3: Perform a clean boot to isolate which service/app causes slowdown.
step_4: Uninstall rarely used programs and disable heavy telemetry services.
step_5: Schedule heavy tasks (backups, updates) for off-hours.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'Services running unnecessarily' and becomes slow.
symptoms: Symptoms: Services running unnecessarily. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Background Processes & Too Many Startup Apps.
cause: Too many startup apps or background services using CPU, disk, or network resources.
step_1: Open Startup settings and disable unnecessary startup apps.
step_2: Use Task Manager to identify background services consuming resources and stop them.
step_3: Perform a clean boot to isolate which service/app causes slowdown.
step_4: Uninstall rarely used programs and disable heavy telemetry services.
step_5: Schedule heavy tasks (backups, updates) for off-hours.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Services running unnecessarily - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'Apps freezing' and becomes slow.
symptoms: Symptoms: Apps freezing. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Software / Application Performance Issues.
cause: Inefficient application behavior, bugs, or incompatibility causing slow response.
step_1: Update the problematic application to the latest version.
step_2: Clear the app cache or reset app settings if available.
step_3: Reinstall the app if performance issues persist.
step_4: Check for known issues or patches from the app vendor.
step_5: Limit resource-heavy features or use alternative lighter apps.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Apps freezing - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

error_name: System freezing due to low memory
user_error_text: System freezing due to low memory happens when I run multiple apps.
symptoms: Symptoms: System freezing due to low memory. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Low RAM / Memory Pressure.
cause: Insufficient physical memory or memory leaks causing paging and slowdowns.
step_1: Check memory usage in Task Manager and close memory-hungry apps.
step_2: Increase virtual memory (paging file) temporarily if needed.
step_3: Restart the system to clear memory leaks and cached data.
step_4: If RAM pressure is frequent, add more RAM modules or close unused apps.
step_5: Use lighter browser settings (fewer tabs/extensions) to reduce memory use.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: System freezing due to low memory - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'Corrupt registry entries' and becomes slow.
symptoms: Symptoms: Corrupt registry entries. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Windows System Corruption / OS Problems.
cause: Corrupt system files, problematic updates or registry issues degrading performance.
step_1: Run `sfc /scannow` to repair system files and `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth`.
step_2: Check Event Viewer for performance-related errors and investigate.
step_3: Uninstall recent problematic updates if performance dropped after an update.
step_4: Consider an in-place upgrade repair using Windows installation media.
step_5: Backup data and perform a clean install if corruption is extensive.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Corrupt registry entries - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: I notice: Fans at full speed — system responds poorly.
symptoms: Symptoms: Fans at full speed. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Overheating & Thermal Throttling.
cause: Thermal throttling due to poor cooling or high ambient temperature.
step_1: Monitor temps with HWMonitor or similar; check if CPU/GPU temps exceed safe limits.
step_2: Clean dust from heatsinks and ensure fans spin properly.
step_3: Reapply thermal paste to CPU if it's old.
step_4: Ensure case airflow is good; move the system to a cooler location.
step_5: If laptop, use a cooling pad; consider upgrading cooler for desktops.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Fans at full speed - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: Read/Write throttling happens when I run multiple apps.
symptoms: Symptoms: Read/Write throttling. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: High Disk Usage / Disk Bottleneck.
cause: Background indexing, failing drive, paging, or heavy I/O operations causing disk bottleneck.
step_1: Open Task Manager and check disk usage; identify processes with heavy I/O.
step_2: Run `chkdsk` and check drive health with SMART tools like CrystalDiskInfo.
step_3: Disable Windows Search or Superfetch temporarily to test impact.
step_4: Free disk space by deleting large unused files and cleaning temp files.
step_5: Consider upgrading to an SSD if using an old HDD.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Read/Write throttling - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: After recent updates I see 'Wi-Fi interference causing slow apps'.
symptoms: Symptoms: Wi-Fi interference causing slow apps. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Network & Internet Slowdowns (System-wide impact).
cause: Slow network affecting cloud apps and downloads, causing perceived system slowness.
step_1: Run a speed test and confirm if network speeds are below expected.
step_2: Pause background updates and large downloads to free bandwidth.
step_3: If Wi‑Fi, move closer to the router or use Ethernet for stable connection.
step_4: Check router and ISP status for external issues.
step_5: Use QoS settings on router to prioritize critical apps.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Wi-Fi interference causing slow apps - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: After recent updates I see 'Large apps using storage'.
symptoms: Symptoms: Large apps using storage. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Storage Capacity Issues.
cause: Low free space forcing excessive paging and preventing caching; fragmented drives.
step_1: Free up space on C: by deleting large temporary files and uninstalling unused apps.
step_2: Use Disk Cleanup and Storage Sense to remove temp files and old system files.
step_3: Move large media files to an external drive to free internal storage.
step_4: Consider upgrading to a larger SSD or adding a secondary drive.
step_5: Defragment HDDs (not SSDs) to improve access times.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Large apps using storage - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: Background task spike happens when I run multiple apps.
symptoms: Symptoms: Background task spike. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: High CPU Usage Problems.
cause: High CPU demand by apps/processes, runaway tasks, or insufficient CPU for workload.
step_1: Open Task Manager (Ctrl+Shift+Esc) and sort processes by CPU to find the culprit.
step_2: End the high-CPU process if it's non-essential and relaunch the app.
step_3: Disable unnecessary startup programs (Settings → Apps → Startup).
step_4: Run a virus scan to check for malware causing CPU spikes.
step_5: If CPU is frequently maxed, consider upgrading CPU or optimizing workloads.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Background task spike - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'Old HDD extremely slow' and becomes slow.
symptoms: Symptoms: Old HDD extremely slow. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Hardware Aging / Limitations.
cause: Aging components (HDD, CPU, RAM) no longer meet workload requirements.
step_1: Check component benchmarks vs current software requirements.
step_2: Upgrade bottleneck components (SSD, RAM, CPU) where possible.
step_3: Reduce graphical or compute settings in resource-heavy applications.
step_4: Keep drivers and firmware up to date to improve compatibility.
step_5: If device is old, consider replacing it for better performance.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Old HDD extremely slow - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

category: Background Processes & Too Many Startup Apps
user_error_text: After recent updates I see 'Telemetry services slowing system'.
symptoms: Symptoms: Telemetry services slowing system. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Background Processes & Too Many Startup Apps.
cause: Too many startup apps or background services using CPU, disk, or network resources.
step_1: Open Startup settings and disable unnecessary startup apps.
step_2: Use Task Manager to identify background services consuming resources and stop them.
step_3: Perform a clean boot to isolate which service/app causes slowdown.
step_4: Uninstall rarely used programs and disable heavy telemetry services.
step_5: Schedule heavy tasks (backups, updates) for off-hours.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Telemetry services slowing system - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: After recent updates I see 'Thermal throttling under load'.
symptoms: Symptoms: Thermal throttling under load. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Overheating & Thermal Throttling.
cause: Thermal throttling due to poor cooling or high ambient temperature.
step_1: Monitor temps with HWMonitor or similar; check if CPU/GPU temps exceed safe limits.
step_2: Clean dust from heatsinks and ensure fans spin properly.
step_3: Reapply thermal paste to CPU if it's old.
step_4: Ensure case airflow is good; move the system to a cooler location.
step_5: If laptop, use a cooling pad; consider upgrading cooler for desktops.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Thermal throttling under load - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: After recent updates I see 'Old HDD slow boot'.
symptoms: Symptoms: Old HDD slow boot. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: High Disk Usage / Disk Bottleneck.
cause: Background indexing, failing drive, paging, or heavy I/O operations causing disk bottleneck.
step_1: Open Task Manager and check disk usage; identify processes with heavy I/O.
step_2: Run `chkdsk` and check drive health with SMART tools like CrystalDiskInfo.
step_3: Disable Windows Search or Superfetch temporarily to test impact.
step_4: Free disk space by deleting large unused files and cleaning temp files.
step_5: Consider upgrading to an SSD if using an old HDD.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Old HDD slow boot - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: C drive full happens when I run multiple apps.
symptoms: Symptoms: C drive full. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Storage Capacity Issues.
cause: Low free space forcing excessive paging and preventing caching; fragmented drives.
step_1: Free up space on C: by deleting large temporary files and uninstalling unused apps.
step_2: Use Disk Cleanup and Storage Sense to remove temp files and old system files.
step_3: Move large media files to an external drive to free internal storage.
step_4: Consider upgrading to a larger SSD or adding a secondary drive.
step_5: Defragment HDDs (not SSDs) to improve access times.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: C drive full - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: Windows Update consuming CPU — performance is very bad.
symptoms: Symptoms: Windows Update consuming CPU. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: High CPU Usage Problems.
cause: High CPU demand by apps/processes, runaway tasks, or insufficient CPU for workload.
step_1: Open Task Manager (Ctrl+Shift+Esc) and sort processes by CPU to find the culprit.
step_2: End the high-CPU process if it's non-essential and relaunch the app.
step_3: Disable unnecessary startup programs (Settings → Apps → Startup).
step_4: Run a virus scan to check for malware causing CPU spikes.
step_5: If CPU is frequently maxed, consider upgrading CPU or optimizing workloads.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Windows Update consuming CPU - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: After recent updates I see 'Lag due to background downloads'.
symptoms: Symptoms: Lag due to background downloads. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Network & Internet Slowdowns (System-wide impact).
cause: Slow network affecting cloud apps and downloads, causing perceived system slowness.
step_1: Run a speed test and confirm if network speeds are below expected.
step_2: Pause background updates and large downloads to free bandwidth.
step_3: If Wi‑Fi, move closer to the router or use Ethernet for stable connection.
step_4: Check router and ISP status for external issues.
step_5: Use QoS settings on router to prioritize critical apps.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Lag due to background downloads - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: I notice: Corrupt registry entries — system responds poorly.
symptoms: Symptoms: Corrupt registry entries. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Windows System Corruption / OS Problems.
cause: Corrupt system files, problematic updates or registry issues degrading performance.
step_1: Run `sfc /scannow` to repair system files and `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth`.
step_2: Check Event Viewer for performance-related errors and investigate.
step_3: Uninstall recent problematic updates if performance dropped after an update.
step_4: Consider an in-place upgrade repair using Windows installation media.
step_5: Backup data and perform a clean install if corruption is extensive.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.

user_error_text: Memory pressure during multitasking happens when I run multiple apps.
symptoms: Symptoms: Memory pressure during multitasking. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Low RAM / Memory Pressure.
cause: Insufficient physical memory or memory leaks causing paging and slowdowns.
step_1: Check memory usage in Task Manager and close memory-hungry apps.
step_2: Increase virtual memory (paging file) temporarily if needed.
step_3: Restart the system to clear memory leaks and cached data.
step_4: If RAM pressure is frequent, add more RAM modules or close unused apps.
step_5: Use lighter browser settings (fewer tabs/extensions) to reduce memory use.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.

cause: Corrupt system files, problematic updates or registry issues degrading performance.
step_1: Run `sfc /scannow` to repair system files and `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth`.
step_2: Check Event Viewer for performance-related errors and investigate.
step_3: Uninstall recent problematic updates if performance dropped after an update.
step_4: Consider an in-place upgrade repair using Windows installation media.
step_5: Backup data and perform a clean install if corruption is extensive.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Slow Windows boot time - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: After recent updates I see 'Lag due to background downloads'.
symptoms: Symptoms: Lag due to background downloads. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Network & Internet Slowdowns (System-wide impact).
cause: Slow network affecting cloud apps and downloads, causing perceived system slowness.
step_1: Run a speed test and confirm if network speeds are below expected.
step_2: Pause background updates and large downloads to free bandwidth.
step_3: If Wi‑Fi, move closer to the router or use Ethernet for stable connection.
step_4: Check router and ISP status for external issues.
step_5: Use QoS settings on router to prioritize critical apps.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Lag due to background downloads - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: After recent updates I see 'Laptop thermal design poor'.
symptoms: Symptoms: Laptop thermal design poor. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Hardware Aging / Limitations.
cause: Aging components (HDD, CPU, RAM) no longer meet workload requirements.
step_1: Check component benchmarks vs current software requirements.
step_2: Upgrade bottleneck components (SSD, RAM, CPU) where possible.
step_3: Reduce graphical or compute settings in resource-heavy applications.
step_4: Keep drivers and firmware up to date to improve compatibility.
step_5: If device is old, consider replacing it for better performance.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Laptop thermal design poor - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: After recent updates I see 'Old HDD slow boot'.
symptoms: Symptoms: Old HDD slow boot. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: High Disk Usage / Disk Bottleneck.
cause: Background indexing, failing drive, paging, or heavy I/O operations causing disk bottleneck.
step_1: Open Task Manager and check disk usage; identify processes with heavy I/O.
step_2: Run `chkdsk` and check drive health with SMART tools like CrystalDiskInfo.
step_3: Disable Windows Search or Superfetch temporarily to test impact.
step_4: Free disk space by deleting large unused files and cleaning temp files.
step_5: Consider upgrading to an SSD if using an old HDD.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Old HDD slow boot - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

category: Background Processes & Too Many Startup Apps
user_error_text: Too many startup programs — performance is very bad.
symptoms: Symptoms: Too many startup programs. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Background Processes & Too Many Startup Apps.
cause: Too many startup apps or background services using CPU, disk, or network resources.
step_1: Open Startup settings and disable unnecessary startup apps.
step_2: Use Task Manager to identify background services consuming resources and stop them.
step_3: Perform a clean boot to isolate which service/app causes slowdown.
step_4: Uninstall rarely used programs and disable heavy telemetry services.
step_5: Schedule heavy tasks (backups, updates) for off-hours.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Too many startup programs - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: Temp files causing slowness happens when I run multiple apps.
symptoms: Symptoms: Temp files causing slowness. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Storage Capacity Issues.
cause: Low free space forcing excessive paging and preventing caching; fragmented drives.
step_1: Free up space on C: by deleting large temporary files and uninstalling unused apps.
step_2: Use Disk Cleanup and Storage Sense to remove temp files and old system files.
step_3: Move large media files to an external drive to free internal storage.
step_4: Consider upgrading to a larger SSD or adding a secondary drive.
step_5: Defragment HDDs (not SSDs) to improve access times.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Temp files causing slowness - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

error_name: System freezing due to low memory
user_error_text: System freezing due to low memory — performance is very bad.
symptoms: Symptoms: System freezing due to low memory. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Low RAM / Memory Pressure.
cause: Insufficient physical memory or memory leaks causing paging and slowdowns.
step_1: Check memory usage in Task Manager and close memory-hungry apps.
step_2: Increase virtual memory (paging file) temporarily if needed.
step_3: Restart the system to clear memory leaks and cached data.
step_4: If RAM pressure is frequent, add more RAM modules or close unused apps.
step_5: Use lighter browser settings (fewer tabs/extensions) to reduce memory use.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: System freezing due to low memory - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: Windows Update consuming CPU — performance is very bad.
symptoms: Symptoms: Windows Update consuming CPU. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: High CPU Usage Problems.
cause: High CPU demand by apps/processes, runaway tasks, or insufficient CPU for workload.
step_1: Open Task Manager (Ctrl+Shift+Esc) and sort processes by CPU to find the culprit.
step_2: End the high-CPU process if it's non-essential and relaunch the app.
step_3: Disable unnecessary startup programs (Settings → Apps → Startup).
step_4: Run a virus scan to check for malware causing CPU spikes.
step_5: If CPU is frequently maxed, consider upgrading CPU or optimizing workloads.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Windows Update consuming CPU - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

category: Background Processes & Too Many Startup Apps
user_error_text: My PC shows 'Background apps causing lag' and becomes slow.
symptoms: Symptoms: Background apps causing lag. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Background Processes & Too Many Startup Apps.
cause: Too many startup apps or background services using CPU, disk, or network resources.
step_1: Open Startup settings and disable unnecessary startup apps.
step_2: Use Task Manager to identify background services consuming resources and stop them.
step_3: Perform a clean boot to isolate which service/app causes slowdown.
step_4: Uninstall rarely used programs and disable heavy telemetry services.
step_5: Schedule heavy tasks (backups, updates) for off-hours.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Background apps causing lag - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'Explorer freezing' and becomes slow.
symptoms: Symptoms: Explorer freezing. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Windows System Corruption / OS Problems.
cause: Corrupt system files, problematic updates or registry issues degrading performance.
step_1: Run `sfc /scannow` to repair system files and `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth`.
step_2: Check Event Viewer for performance-related errors and investigate.
step_3: Uninstall recent problematic updates if performance dropped after an update.
step_4: Consider an in-place upgrade repair using Windows installation media.
step_5: Backup data and perform a clean install if corruption is extensive.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Explorer freezing - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'Fans at full speed' and becomes slow.
symptoms: Symptoms: Fans at full speed. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Overheating & Thermal Throttling.
cause: Thermal throttling due to poor cooling or high ambient temperature.
step_1: Monitor temps with HWMonitor or similar; check if CPU/GPU temps exceed safe limits.
step_2: Clean dust from heatsinks and ensure fans spin properly.
step_3: Reapply thermal paste to CPU if it's old.
step_4: Ensure case airflow is good; move the system to a cooler location.
step_5: If laptop, use a cooling pad; consider upgrading cooler for desktops.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Fans at full speed - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'High ping in games' and becomes slow.
symptoms: Symptoms: High ping in games. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Network & Internet Slowdowns (System-wide impact).
cause: Slow network affecting cloud apps and downloads, causing perceived system slowness.
step_1: Run a speed test and confirm if network speeds are below expected.
step_2: Pause background updates and large downloads to free bandwidth.
step_3: If Wi‑Fi, move closer to the router or use Ethernet for stable connection.
step_4: Check router and ISP status for external issues.
step_5: Use QoS settings on router to prioritize critical apps.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: High ping in games - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: After recent updates I see 'Laptop thermal design poor'.
symptoms: Symptoms: Laptop thermal design poor. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Hardware Aging / Limitations.
cause: Aging components (HDD, CPU, RAM) no longer meet workload requirements.
step_1: Check component benchmarks vs current software requirements.
step_2: Upgrade bottleneck components (SSD, RAM, CPU) where possible.
step_3: Reduce graphical or compute settings in resource-heavy applications.
step_4: Keep drivers and firmware up to date to improve compatibility.
step_5: If device is old, consider replacing it for better performance.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Laptop thermal design poor - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'Paging file excessive usage' and becomes slow.
symptoms: Symptoms: Paging file excessive usage. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: High Disk Usage / Disk Bottleneck.
cause: Background indexing, failing drive, paging, or heavy I/O operations causing disk bottleneck.
step_1: Open Task Manager and check disk usage; identify processes with heavy I/O.
step_2: Run `chkdsk` and check drive health with SMART tools like CrystalDiskInfo.
step_3: Disable Windows Search or Superfetch temporarily to test impact.
step_4: Free disk space by deleting large unused files and cleaning temp files.
step_5: Consider upgrading to an SSD if using an old HDD.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Paging file excessive usage - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: Low disk space warning happens when I run multiple apps.
symptoms: Symptoms: Low disk space warning. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Storage Capacity Issues.
cause: Low free space forcing excessive paging and preventing caching; fragmented drives.
step_1: Free up space on C: by deleting large temporary files and uninstalling unused apps.
step_2: Use Disk Cleanup and Storage Sense to remove temp files and old system files.
step_3: Move large media files to an external drive to free internal storage.
step_4: Consider upgrading to a larger SSD or adding a secondary drive.
step_5: Defragment HDDs (not SSDs) to improve access times.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Low disk space warning - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'Slow file transfers' and becomes slow.
symptoms: Symptoms: Slow file transfers. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: High Disk Usage / Disk Bottleneck.
cause: Background indexing, failing drive, paging, or heavy I/O operations causing disk bottleneck.
step_1: Open Task Manager and check disk usage; identify processes with heavy I/O.
step_2: Run `chkdsk` and check drive health with SMART tools like CrystalDiskInfo.
step_3: Disable Windows Search or Superfetch temporarily to test impact.
step_4: Free disk space by deleting large unused files and cleaning temp files.
step_5: Consider upgrading to an SSD if using an old HDD.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Slow file transfers - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: High RAM usage (80-100%) happens when I run multiple apps.
symptoms: Symptoms: High RAM usage (80-100%). Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Low RAM / Memory Pressure.
cause: Insufficient physical memory or memory leaks causing paging and slowdowns.
step_1: Check memory usage in Task Manager and close memory-hungry apps.
step_2: Increase virtual memory (paging file) temporarily if needed.
step_3: Restart the system to clear memory leaks and cached data.
step_4: If RAM pressure is frequent, add more RAM modules or close unused apps.
step_5: Use lighter browser settings (fewer tabs/extensions) to reduce memory use.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: High RAM usage (80-100%) - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

cause: High CPU demand by apps/processes, runaway tasks, or insufficient CPU for workload.
step_1: Open Task Manager (Ctrl+Shift+Esc) and sort processes by CPU to find the culprit.
step_2: End the high-CPU process if it's non-essential and relaunch the app.
step_3: Disable unnecessary startup programs (Settings → Apps → Startup).
step_4: Run a virus scan to check for malware causing CPU spikes.
step_5: If CPU is frequently maxed, consider upgrading CPU or optimizing workloads.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.

user_error_text: After recent updates I see 'Fragmented HDD'.
symptoms: Symptoms: Fragmented HDD. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Storage Capacity Issues.
cause: Low free space forcing excessive paging and preventing caching; fragmented drives.
step_1: Free up space on C: by deleting large temporary files and uninstalling unused apps.
step_2: Use Disk Cleanup and Storage Sense to remove temp files and old system files.
step_3: Move large media files to an external drive to free internal storage.
step_4: Consider upgrading to a larger SSD or adding a secondary drive.
step_5: Defragment HDDs (not SSDs) to improve access times.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Fragmented HDD - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: I notice: Slow file transfers — system responds poorly.
symptoms: Symptoms: Slow file transfers. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: High Disk Usage / Disk Bottleneck.
cause: Background indexing, failing drive, paging, or heavy I/O operations causing disk bottleneck.
step_1: Open Task Manager and check disk usage; identify processes with heavy I/O.
step_2: Run `chkdsk` and check drive health with SMART tools like CrystalDiskInfo.
step_3: Disable Windows Search or Superfetch temporarily to test impact.
step_4: Free disk space by deleting large unused files and cleaning temp files.
step_5: Consider upgrading to an SSD if using an old HDD.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.

user_error_text: After recent updates I see 'Memory pressure during multitasking'.
symptoms: Symptoms: Memory pressure during multitasking. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Low RAM / Memory Pressure.
cause: Insufficient physical memory or memory leaks causing paging and slowdowns.
step_1: Check memory usage in Task Manager and close memory-hungry apps.
step_2: Increase virtual memory (paging file) temporarily if needed.
step_3: Restart the system to clear memory leaks and cached data.
step_4: If RAM pressure is frequent, add more RAM modules or close unused apps.
step_5: Use lighter browser settings (fewer tabs/extensions) to reduce memory use.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Memory pressure during multitasking - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'Apps freezing' and becomes slow.
symptoms: Symptoms: Apps freezing. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Software / Application Performance Issues.
cause: Inefficient application behavior, bugs, or incompatibility causing slow response.
step_1: Update the problematic application to the latest version.
step_2: Clear the app cache or reset app settings if available.
step_3: Reinstall the app if performance issues persist.
step_4: Check for known issues or patches from the app vendor.
step_5: Limit resource-heavy features or use alternative lighter apps.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.

user_error_text: I notice: Explorer freezing — system responds poorly.
symptoms: Symptoms: Explorer freezing. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Windows System Corruption / OS Problems.
cause: Corrupt system files, problematic updates or registry issues degrading performance.
step_1: Run `sfc /scannow` to repair system files and `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth`.
step_2: Check Event Viewer for performance-related errors and investigate.
step_3: Uninstall recent problematic updates if performance dropped after an update.
step_4: Consider an in-place upgrade repair using Windows installation media.
step_5: Backup data and perform a clean install if corruption is extensive.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Explorer freezing - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: I notice: Fans at full speed — system responds poorly.
symptoms: Symptoms: Fans at full speed. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Overheating & Thermal Throttling.
cause: Thermal throttling due to poor cooling or high ambient temperature.
step_1: Monitor temps with HWMonitor or similar; check if CPU/GPU temps exceed safe limits.
step_2: Clean dust from heatsinks and ensure fans spin properly.
step_3: Reapply thermal paste to CPU if it's old.
step_4: Ensure case airflow is good; move the system to a cooler location.
step_5: If laptop, use a cooling pad; consider upgrading cooler for desktops.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Fans at full speed - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

cause: High CPU demand by apps/processes, runaway tasks, or insufficient CPU for workload.

step_5: If CPU is frequently maxed, consider upgrading CPU or optimizing workloads.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.

step_1: Monitor temps with HWMonitor or similar; check if CPU/GPU temps exceed safe limits.
step_2: Clean dust from heatsinks and ensure fans spin properly.
step_3: Reapply thermal paste to CPU if it's old.
step_4: Ensure case airflow is good; move the system to a cooler location.
step_5: If laptop, use a cooling pad; consider upgrading cooler for desktops.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Laptop hot while gaming - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'GPU thermal throttling' and becomes slow.
symptoms: Symptoms: GPU thermal throttling. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Overheating & Thermal Throttling.
cause: Thermal throttling due to poor cooling or high ambient temperature.
step_1: Monitor temps with HWMonitor or similar; check if CPU/GPU temps exceed safe limits.
step_2: Clean dust from heatsinks and ensure fans spin properly.
step_3: Reapply thermal paste to CPU if it's old.
step_4: Ensure case airflow is good; move the system to a cooler location.
step_5: If laptop, use a cooling pad; consider upgrading cooler for desktops.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: GPU thermal throttling - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: Large apps using storage happens when I run multiple apps.
symptoms: Symptoms: Large apps using storage. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Storage Capacity Issues.
cause: Low free space forcing excessive paging and preventing caching; fragmented drives.
step_1: Free up space on C: by deleting large temporary files and uninstalling unused apps.
step_2: Use Disk Cleanup and Storage Sense to remove temp files and old system files.
step_3: Move large media files to an external drive to free internal storage.
step_4: Consider upgrading to a larger SSD or adding a secondary drive.
step_5: Defragment HDDs (not SSDs) to improve access times.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Large apps using storage - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: After recent updates I see 'High RAM usage (80-100%)'.
symptoms: Symptoms: High RAM usage (80-100%). Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Low RAM / Memory Pressure.
cause: Insufficient physical memory or memory leaks causing paging and slowdowns.
step_1: Check memory usage in Task Manager and close memory-hungry apps.
step_2: Increase virtual memory (paging file) temporarily if needed.
step_3: Restart the system to clear memory leaks and cached data.
step_4: If RAM pressure is frequent, add more RAM modules or close unused apps.
step_5: Use lighter browser settings (fewer tabs/extensions) to reduce memory use.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: High RAM usage (80-100%) - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

category: Background Processes & Too Many Startup Apps
user_error_text: My PC shows 'Background apps causing lag' and becomes slow.
symptoms: Symptoms: Background apps causing lag. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Background Processes & Too Many Startup Apps.
cause: Too many startup apps or background services using CPU, disk, or network resources.
step_1: Open Startup settings and disable unnecessary startup apps.
step_2: Use Task Manager to identify background services consuming resources and stop them.
step_3: Perform a clean boot to isolate which service/app causes slowdown.
step_4: Uninstall rarely used programs and disable heavy telemetry services.
step_5: Schedule heavy tasks (backups, updates) for off-hours.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Background apps causing lag - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'Explorer freezing' and becomes slow.
symptoms: Symptoms: Explorer freezing. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Windows System Corruption / OS Problems.
cause: Corrupt system files, problematic updates or registry issues degrading performance.
step_1: Run `sfc /scannow` to repair system files and `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth`.
step_2: Check Event Viewer for performance-related errors and investigate.
step_3: Uninstall recent problematic updates if performance dropped after an update.
step_4: Consider an in-place upgrade repair using Windows installation media.
step_5: Backup data and perform a clean install if corruption is extensive.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Explorer freezing - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

cause: Slow network affecting cloud apps and downloads, causing perceived system slowness.
step_1: Run a speed test and confirm if network speeds are below expected.
step_2: Pause background updates and large downloads to free bandwidth.
step_3: If Wi‑Fi, move closer to the router or use Ethernet for stable connection.
step_4: Check router and ISP status for external issues.
step_5: Use QoS settings on router to prioritize critical apps.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.

user_error_text: Antivirus high CPU happens when I run multiple apps.
symptoms: Symptoms: Antivirus high CPU. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: High CPU Usage Problems.
cause: High CPU demand by apps/processes, runaway tasks, or insufficient CPU for workload.
step_1: Open Task Manager (Ctrl+Shift+Esc) and sort processes by CPU to find the culprit.
step_2: End the high-CPU process if it's non-essential and relaunch the app.
step_3: Disable unnecessary startup programs (Settings → Apps → Startup).
step_4: Run a virus scan to check for malware causing CPU spikes.
step_5: If CPU is frequently maxed, consider upgrading CPU or optimizing workloads.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Antivirus high CPU - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: Windows Search high disk use happens when I run multiple apps.
symptoms: Symptoms: Windows Search high disk use. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: High Disk Usage / Disk Bottleneck.
cause: Background indexing, failing drive, paging, or heavy I/O operations causing disk bottleneck.
step_1: Open Task Manager and check disk usage; identify processes with heavy I/O.
step_2: Run `chkdsk` and check drive health with SMART tools like CrystalDiskInfo.
step_3: Disable Windows Search or Superfetch temporarily to test impact.
step_4: Free disk space by deleting large unused files and cleaning temp files.
step_5: Consider upgrading to an SSD if using an old HDD.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Windows Search high disk use - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

cause: Aging components (HDD, CPU, RAM) no longer meet workload requirements.
step_1: Check component benchmarks vs current software requirements.

user_error_text: After recent updates I see 'Corrupt registry entries'.
symptoms: Symptoms: Corrupt registry entries. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Windows System Corruption / OS Problems.
cause: Corrupt system files, problematic updates or registry issues degrading performance.
step_1: Run `sfc /scannow` to repair system files and `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth`.
step_2: Check Event Viewer for performance-related errors and investigate.
step_3: Uninstall recent problematic updates if performance dropped after an update.
step_4: Consider an in-place upgrade repair using Windows installation media.
step_5: Backup data and perform a clean install if corruption is extensive.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.

category: Background Processes & Too Many Startup Apps
user_error_text: After recent updates I see 'Background apps causing lag'.
symptoms: Symptoms: Background apps causing lag. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Background Processes & Too Many Startup Apps.
cause: Too many startup apps or background services using CPU, disk, or network resources.
step_1: Open Startup settings and disable unnecessary startup apps.
step_2: Use Task Manager to identify background services consuming resources and stop them.
step_3: Perform a clean boot to isolate which service/app causes slowdown.
step_4: Uninstall rarely used programs and disable heavy telemetry services.
step_5: Schedule heavy tasks (backups, updates) for off-hours.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Background apps causing lag - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: After recent updates I see 'Browser memory leak'.
symptoms: Symptoms: Browser memory leak. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Low RAM / Memory Pressure.
cause: Insufficient physical memory or memory leaks causing paging and slowdowns.
step_1: Check memory usage in Task Manager and close memory-hungry apps.
step_2: Increase virtual memory (paging file) temporarily if needed.
step_3: Restart the system to clear memory leaks and cached data.
step_4: If RAM pressure is frequent, add more RAM modules or close unused apps.
step_5: Use lighter browser settings (fewer tabs/extensions) to reduce memory use.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Browser memory leak - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'Background task spike' and becomes slow.
symptoms: Symptoms: Background task spike. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: High CPU Usage Problems.
cause: High CPU demand by apps/processes, runaway tasks, or insufficient CPU for workload.
step_1: Open Task Manager (Ctrl+Shift+Esc) and sort processes by CPU to find the culprit.
step_2: End the high-CPU process if it's non-essential and relaunch the app.
step_3: Disable unnecessary startup programs (Settings → Apps → Startup).
step_4: Run a virus scan to check for malware causing CPU spikes.
step_5: If CPU is frequently maxed, consider upgrading CPU or optimizing workloads.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Background task spike - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: After recent updates I see 'Wi-Fi interference causing slow apps'.
symptoms: Symptoms: Wi-Fi interference causing slow apps. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Network & Internet Slowdowns (System-wide impact).
cause: Slow network affecting cloud apps and downloads, causing perceived system slowness.

step_5: Use QoS settings on router to prioritize critical apps.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.

user_error_text: Read/Write throttling — performance is very bad.
symptoms: Symptoms: Read/Write throttling. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: High Disk Usage / Disk Bottleneck.
cause: Background indexing, failing drive, paging, or heavy I/O operations causing disk bottleneck.
step_1: Open Task Manager and check disk usage; identify processes with heavy I/O.
step_2: Run `chkdsk` and check drive health with SMART tools like CrystalDiskInfo.
step_3: Disable Windows Search or Superfetch temporarily to test impact.
step_4: Free disk space by deleting large unused files and cleaning temp files.
step_5: Consider upgrading to an SSD if using an old HDD.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Read/Write throttling - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: Fragmented HDD happens when I run multiple apps.
symptoms: Symptoms: Fragmented HDD. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Storage Capacity Issues.
cause: Low free space forcing excessive paging and preventing caching; fragmented drives.
step_1: Free up space on C: by deleting large temporary files and uninstalling unused apps.
step_2: Use Disk Cleanup and Storage Sense to remove temp files and old system files.
step_3: Move large media files to an external drive to free internal storage.
step_4: Consider upgrading to a larger SSD or adding a secondary drive.
step_5: Defragment HDDs (not SSDs) to improve access times.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Fragmented HDD - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

step_4: Keep drivers and firmware up to date to improve compatibility.
step_5: If device is old, consider replacing it for better performance.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Weak CPU can't handle apps - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: After recent updates I see 'Corrupt registry entries'.
symptoms: Symptoms: Corrupt registry entries. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Windows System Corruption / OS Problems.
cause: Corrupt system files, problematic updates or registry issues degrading performance.
step_1: Run `sfc /scannow` to repair system files and `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth`.
step_2: Check Event Viewer for performance-related errors and investigate.
step_3: Uninstall recent problematic updates if performance dropped after an update.
step_4: Consider an in-place upgrade repair using Windows installation media.
step_5: Backup data and perform a clean install if corruption is extensive.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Corrupt registry entries - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: After recent updates I see 'Laptop hot while gaming'.
symptoms: Symptoms: Laptop hot while gaming. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Overheating & Thermal Throttling.
cause: Thermal throttling due to poor cooling or high ambient temperature.
step_1: Monitor temps with HWMonitor or similar; check if CPU/GPU temps exceed safe limits.
step_2: Clean dust from heatsinks and ensure fans spin properly.
step_3: Reapply thermal paste to CPU if it's old.
step_4: Ensure case airflow is good; move the system to a cooler location.
step_5: If laptop, use a cooling pad; consider upgrading cooler for desktops.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Laptop hot while gaming - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: I notice: Old HDD slow boot — system responds poorly.
symptoms: Symptoms: Old HDD slow boot. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: High Disk Usage / Disk Bottleneck.
cause: Background indexing, failing drive, paging, or heavy I/O operations causing disk bottleneck.
step_1: Open Task Manager and check disk usage; identify processes with heavy I/O.
step_2: Run `chkdsk` and check drive health with SMART tools like CrystalDiskInfo.
step_3: Disable Windows Search or Superfetch temporarily to test impact.
step_4: Free disk space by deleting large unused files and cleaning temp files.
step_5: Consider upgrading to an SSD if using an old HDD.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Old HDD slow boot - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: After recent updates I see 'Large apps using storage'.
symptoms: Symptoms: Large apps using storage. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Storage Capacity Issues.
cause: Low free space forcing excessive paging and preventing caching; fragmented drives.
step_1: Free up space on C: by deleting large temporary files and uninstalling unused apps.
step_2: Use Disk Cleanup and Storage Sense to remove temp files and old system files.
step_3: Move large media files to an external drive to free internal storage.
step_4: Consider upgrading to a larger SSD or adding a secondary drive.
step_5: Defragment HDDs (not SSDs) to improve access times.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Large apps using storage - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

category: Background Processes & Too Many Startup Apps
user_error_text: Too many startup programs happens when I run multiple apps.
symptoms: Symptoms: Too many startup programs. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Background Processes & Too Many Startup Apps.
cause: Too many startup apps or background services using CPU, disk, or network resources.
step_1: Open Startup settings and disable unnecessary startup apps.
step_2: Use Task Manager to identify background services consuming resources and stop them.
step_3: Perform a clean boot to isolate which service/app causes slowdown.
step_4: Uninstall rarely used programs and disable heavy telemetry services.
step_5: Schedule heavy tasks (backups, updates) for off-hours.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Too many startup programs - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'High CPU usage (90-100%)' and becomes slow.
symptoms: Symptoms: High CPU usage (90-100%). Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: High CPU Usage Problems.
cause: High CPU demand by apps/processes, runaway tasks, or insufficient CPU for workload.
step_1: Open Task Manager (Ctrl+Shift+Esc) and sort processes by CPU to find the culprit.
step_2: End the high-CPU process if it's non-essential and relaunch the app.
step_3: Disable unnecessary startup programs (Settings → Apps → Startup).
step_4: Run a virus scan to check for malware causing CPU spikes.
step_5: If CPU is frequently maxed, consider upgrading CPU or optimizing workloads.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.

cause: Inefficient application behavior, bugs, or incompatibility causing slow response.

step_4: Check for known issues or patches from the app vendor.
step_5: Limit resource-heavy features or use alternative lighter apps.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'High ping in games' and becomes slow.
symptoms: Symptoms: High ping in games. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Network & Internet Slowdowns (System-wide impact).
cause: Slow network affecting cloud apps and downloads, causing perceived system slowness.
step_1: Run a speed test and confirm if network speeds are below expected.
step_2: Pause background updates and large downloads to free bandwidth.
step_3: If Wi‑Fi, move closer to the router or use Ethernet for stable connection.
step_4: Check router and ISP status for external issues.
step_5: Use QoS settings on router to prioritize critical apps.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: High ping in games - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

cause: Insufficient physical memory or memory leaks causing paging and slowdowns.
step_1: Check memory usage in Task Manager and close memory-hungry apps.
step_2: Increase virtual memory (paging file) temporarily if needed.
step_3: Restart the system to clear memory leaks and cached data.
step_4: If RAM pressure is frequent, add more RAM modules or close unused apps.
step_5: Use lighter browser settings (fewer tabs/extensions) to reduce memory use.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.

step_1: Check memory usage in Task Manager and close memory-hungry apps.
step_2: Increase virtual memory (paging file) temporarily if needed.
step_3: Restart the system to clear memory leaks and cached data.
step_4: If RAM pressure is frequent, add more RAM modules or close unused apps.
step_5: Use lighter browser settings (fewer tabs/extensions) to reduce memory use.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Browser memory leak - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'Office slow' and becomes slow.
symptoms: Symptoms: Office slow. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Software / Application Performance Issues.
cause: Inefficient application behavior, bugs, or incompatibility causing slow response.
step_1: Update the problematic application to the latest version.
step_2: Clear the app cache or reset app settings if available.
step_3: Reinstall the app if performance issues persist.
step_4: Check for known issues or patches from the app vendor.
step_5: Limit resource-heavy features or use alternative lighter apps.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Office slow - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

category: Background Processes & Too Many Startup Apps
user_error_text: My PC shows 'Game launchers in background' and becomes slow.
symptoms: Symptoms: Game launchers in background. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Background Processes & Too Many Startup Apps.
cause: Too many startup apps or background services using CPU, disk, or network resources.
step_1: Open Startup settings and disable unnecessary startup apps.
step_2: Use Task Manager to identify background services consuming resources and stop them.
step_3: Perform a clean boot to isolate which service/app causes slowdown.
step_4: Uninstall rarely used programs and disable heavy telemetry services.
step_5: Schedule heavy tasks (backups, updates) for off-hours.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Game launchers in background - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'Slow file transfers' and becomes slow.
symptoms: Symptoms: Slow file transfers. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: High Disk Usage / Disk Bottleneck.
cause: Background indexing, failing drive, paging, or heavy I/O operations causing disk bottleneck.
step_1: Open Task Manager and check disk usage; identify processes with heavy I/O.
step_2: Run `chkdsk` and check drive health with SMART tools like CrystalDiskInfo.
step_3: Disable Windows Search or Superfetch temporarily to test impact.
step_4: Free disk space by deleting large unused files and cleaning temp files.
step_5: Consider upgrading to an SSD if using an old HDD.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Slow file transfers - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: My PC shows 'Temp files causing slowness' and becomes slow.
symptoms: Symptoms: Temp files causing slowness. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Storage Capacity Issues.
cause: Low free space forcing excessive paging and preventing caching; fragmented drives.
step_1: Free up space on C: by deleting large temporary files and uninstalling unused apps.
step_2: Use Disk Cleanup and Storage Sense to remove temp files and old system files.
step_3: Move large media files to an external drive to free internal storage.
step_4: Consider upgrading to a larger SSD or adding a secondary drive.
step_5: Defragment HDDs (not SSDs) to improve access times.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: Temp files causing slowness - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: GPU thermal throttling happens when I run multiple apps.
symptoms: Symptoms: GPU thermal throttling. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Overheating & Thermal Throttling.
cause: Thermal throttling due to poor cooling or high ambient temperature.
step_1: Monitor temps with HWMonitor or similar; check if CPU/GPU temps exceed safe limits.
step_2: Clean dust from heatsinks and ensure fans spin properly.
step_3: Reapply thermal paste to CPU if it's old.
step_4: Ensure case airflow is good; move the system to a cooler location.
step_5: If laptop, use a cooling pad; consider upgrading cooler for desktops.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: GPU thermal throttling - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

user_error_text: After recent updates I see 'SFC errors'.
symptoms: Symptoms: SFC errors. Causes slow responsiveness, long waits, high resource usage. Category: Windows System Corruption / OS Problems.
cause: Corrupt system files, problematic updates or registry issues degrading performance.
step_1: Run `sfc /scannow` to repair system files and `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth`.
step_2: Check Event Viewer for performance-related errors and investigate.
step_3: Uninstall recent problematic updates if performance dropped after an update.
step_4: Consider an in-place upgrade repair using Windows installation media.
step_5: Backup data and perform a clean install if corruption is extensive.
verification: System runs responsively under normal use and resource metrics return to acceptable ranges.
log_snippet: SFC errors - Performance metric recorded in system monitoring.

step_5: Use QoS settings on router to prioritize critical apps.
